Its an xls, not a css.

You have to use your own XSL stylesheet in stea=
d of the ones from Ant.

If you use the single page report, you need to pro=
vide your own junit-
noframes.xsl stylesheet.
If you use the framed report,=
 you need your own junit-frames.xsl.


Ant writes all your system and error=
 output to it's TEST-xxx.xml file.
But it writes it at testsuite level, not=
 at testmethod level.

If you prefix your output in your tests with 
[testc=
aseclassname.testmethodname], you can cunningly forge an xls 
stylesheet th=
at only takes output relevant for the current 
testmethod, and write the ou=
tput to the type column.


> 
> Thanks.
> 
> But I've no idea about css.
> =
